PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The hole mobilities of the POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers were estimated to be 1.5 × 10^-4 and 1.3 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , respectively.

Let's think step by step.

Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| hole mobilities |

The paragraph mentions the hole mobilities of two polymers, POBDTPD and PEBDTPD. The hole mobility is a property that measures how quickly holes (positive charges) can move through a material. It is expressed in units of square centimeters per volt-second. In this case, the hole mobilities of the two polymers are estimated to be 1.5 × 10^-4 and 1.3 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1, respectively.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

After reviewing the paragraph, I realize that there is only one clear "Material Property" entity in the paragraph. Here it is:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| hole mobilities |

The paragraph mentions the hole mobilities of two polymers, POBDTPD and PEBDTPD. The hole mobility is a material property that measures how quickly holes (positive charges) can move through a material. It is expressed in units of square centimeters per volt-second. In this case, the hole mobilities of the two polymers are estimated to be 1.5 × 10^-4 and 1.3 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1, respectively.

There are no other clear material property entities in the paragraph. The terms "POBDTPD" and "PEBDTPD" are not material properties, but rather the names of the two polymers being studied. The units "cm^2 V -1 s^-1" are not material properties, but rather units of measurement for the hole mobilities.
